conclusion: Determine position at t = 8 seconds using velocity-time graph.
From t = 0 to t = 3 seconds, velocity is 2 m/s.
From t = 3 to t = 4 seconds, velocity is 0 m/s.
From t = 4 to t = 5 seconds, velocity is -1 m/s.
From t = 5 to t = 7 seconds, velocity is 0 m/s.
From t = 7 to t = 8 seconds, velocity is 2 m/s.
Calculate displacement from t = 0 to t = 3 seconds: Δx1 = 6 m.
Position at t = 3 seconds: x(3) = 11 m.
Calculate displacement from t = 3 to t = 4 seconds: Δx2 = 0 m.
Position at t = 4 seconds: x(4) = 11 m.
Calculate displacement from t = 4 to t = 5 seconds: Δx3 = -1 m.
Position at t = 5 seconds: x(5) = 10 m.
Calculate displacement from t = 5 to t = 7 seconds: Δx4 = 0 m.
Position at t = 7 seconds: x(7) = 10 m.
Calculate displacement from t = 7 to t = 8 seconds: Δx5 = 2 m.
Position at t = 8 seconds: x(8) = 12 m.
